intro: Miconia media subsp. ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the humid lowland forests of Ecuador and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in secondary tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
